abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Private Sector
            Industrial Credit Project for Bangladesh were as follows:
            outcomes were satisfactory, project suitability was likely,
            Bank performance was satisfactory, and the Borrower
            performance was also satisfactory. Some lessons learned
            included: in the case of weak institutional capacity by the
            implementation agency and the difficulty to improve such
            capacity during the time scope of the project. In the
            absence of an adequate regulatory framework for the
            financial system, the financial statements for financial
            institutions could be misleading, and therefore an in depth
            analysis of the financial institutions may be necessary when
            adequate information is crucial for project design. The
            timetable for implementation of technical assistance
            components should be realistic, taking into accounts the
            procedures and past experience of the country. Projects
            should openly acknowledge those issues that cannot be
            addressed under that operation but need to be covered at a
            later stage.
